#246

- Growing down the trunk of American Hophornbeam tree on west-facing mixed oak/hickory woodland slope, above creek.
- Flesh tough, leathery and lumpy.
- Some specimens encapsulating old fruiting bodies, sometimes just the hymenium.
- Hymenium elongated pores on areas of fresh growth while maze-like when mature, slightly bruising brown.
- Smell: faintly sweet.
- Taste: slightly bitter.
- KOH: yellow on new growth.
- Ammonia darkening, to not distinctive.
- UV: bright pink on hymenium.
- Spore Print: white.
